basic.floral_language:
Pittosporum phillyreoides
Floriography: persistent, handsome, tenacious.
This plant is a shrub or small tree. Leaf is inverse oval shaped, smooth at tips and leathery. Widely used as hedges, shape builders, and even as blending leaves for bouquets. 
It prefers sunny habitat, partial shade tolerant. Direct bright sunlight should be avoided in summer. Whitish yellow flowers may bloom in March to May if growing well.
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers in March-May, white yellow flowers

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, resistant to half shade, shade properly under summer strong light
maintenance.watering: Moderately resistant to drought, water thoroughly after soil surface dries, water more frequently in summer, reduce watering in winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and summer
